sentences.en: A mockery, indeed, but in which his soul trifled with itself!
sentences.cn: 这确实是一种嘲弄, 但是在这种嘲弄之中,他的灵魂却在自嘲!

sentences.en: He felt it was a mockery, white, empty , oppressive.
sentences.cn: 他觉到一种嘲弄, 一种白的, 渺茫的, 闷气.

sentences.en: He replied with a note of mockery in his voice.
sentences.cn: 他带着嘲笑的声调回答.

sentences.en: His genial sufficiency was a taunt and a mockery to many.
sentences.cn: 他那么和蔼自满的态度,许多人都认为是一种辱骂和嘲弄.

sentences.en: Life was not the mockery she had thought it three days ago.
sentences.cn: 生活不再象她三天前所想的那样可鄙.

sentences.en: She couldn't stand any more of their mockery.
sentences.cn: 她再也无法忍受他们的愚弄了。

sentences.en: The debate was a mockery. A big yawn.
sentences.cn: 这场辩论实在可笑。简直是无聊透顶。

sentences.en: The justice of the Church is not a mockery, my lord.
sentences.cn: 教会法律并不是儿戏, 阁下.

sentences.en: The present system is a mockery of justice.
sentences.cn: 现存体制是对司法的嘲讽。

sentences.en: the terrorists are making a mockery of security policy.
sentences.cn: 恐怖分子正向安全政策挑战。

sentences.en: The unfair trial was a mockery of justice.
sentences.cn: 那不公平的审判是对公正的一种蔑视.

sentences.en: There should be no snobbish mockery of catering or fashion design as university subjects.
sentences.cn: 不应该自命不凡地嘲笑大学里的酒席承办和时装设计课程。

sentences.en: There was a hint of mockery in his voice.
sentences.cn: 他的话音里带着一丝嘲讽。

sentences.en: There was a tone of mockery in his voice.
sentences.cn: 他说话的语气含有嘲笑的意味.

sentences.en: There was mockery in everything he said.
sentences.cn: 他的每一句话里都含有讽刺.

sentences.en: This building plan makes a mockery of the government’s environmental policy.
sentences.cn: 这个建筑规划是对政府环境政策的嘲讽。

sentences.en: Was it but the mockery of penitence?
sentences.cn: 难道只是对忏悔加以嘲弄 吗 ?

sentences.en: Was there a glint of mockery in his eyes?
sentences.cn: 他的眼里是不是闪过一丝讥讽？

words.tran_cn: 模仿鸟；嘲鸫属鸣禽；蓝嘲鸫（等于mocking thrush）
嘲弄；模仿；使…失望；使…无效
嘲弄；笑柄；徒劳无功；拙劣可笑的模仿或歪曲

phrases.tran_cn: 嘲弄，使显愚蠢；使显荒唐

trans.tran_cn: 嘲笑，愚弄，笑柄，（拙劣的）模仿，徒劳
trans.tran_en: to make something such as a plan or system seem completely useless or ineffective
